intro: Echium pycnanthum var. heterophyllum, commonly known as the Sierra Madre evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low, sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves.
